data: Add Add Share via Facebook x.com LinkedIn Email Video Will Not Run on PC 1 but runs fine on PC2 Anonymous 2022-07-15T17:40:16+00:00 There a few videos which will run on 1 of my Win 11 PCs but will not run on a second Win 11 PC. An example of a web site video having the problem is https://www.webmd.com/osteoporosis/guide/osteoporosis-exercise When I right click on the video it is call for an Akamai Adaptive Media Player. Both of my Win 11 PCs do not have the Akamai Adaptive Media Player installed but yet runs fine on 1 PC. It appears that to download Akamai Adaptive Media Player it has a cost which I am not interested in paying. Please help me resolve the issue Windows for home | Windows 11 | Display and graphics Windows for home | Windows 11 | Display and graphics Sign in to follow Follow Locked Question. This question was migrated from the Microsoft Support Community. You can vote on whether it's helpful, but you can't add comments or replies or follow the question. 0 comments No comments Report a concern I have the same question I have the same question 0 {count} votes 9 answers Sort by: Most helpful Most helpful Newest Oldest Anonymous 2022-07-15T18:22:23+00:00 Hi Neil. I'm Greg, 10 years awarded Windows MVP, here to help you. No video appears anywhere on that page you linked. Do I need to click a link there? In any case it's a browser issue as web pages must use embedded players in the browser itself, not Windows players which don't respond to web page links unless they are downloaded first and then directed to the player. You could try another browser. If that doesn't work then since you now the player you can try to install it as a website extension explained here: http://www.yourtechtamer.com/blog/2017/01/what-... You can also ask the webmaster of the website, as they should not expect users to ever have to go find players to see their content, it should be embeddded in the page code to pop up and pay without effort. If you can direct me to the video I can research it more. Feel free to ask back any questions. Based on the results you post back I may have other suggestions if necessary. ______________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it. Please sign in to rate this answer. Yes No 0 comments No comments Report a concern Anonymous 2022-07-15T18:43:12+00:00 Neil, I did get it to load in Edge and Chrome. It has an embedded player that apparently doesn't like my Firefox. They both had hardware acceleration on, so I turned it off and relaunced on the one not working. It did not fix the issue. I then deleted all browsing data (for all time) and relaunched but again problem not solved Please sign in to rate this answer. Yes No 0 comments No comments Report a concern Anonymous 2022-07-16T00:51:08+00:00 OK, let's fully reset Chrome because it should work as it's working on mine. Sign into Chrome sync to save your bookmarks and passwords online easily accessed anywhere by signing into Chrome. Next empty the Chrome cache: https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/3205... Reset Chrome following this guide: https://www.lifewire.com/how-to-reset-google-ch... If that doesn't fix it then do a clean reinstall of Chrome: Right click empty area of Task bar to open Task managerâ. If necessary show More Details Under "Processes," look for "Google Chrome" or "chrome.exe." Click it, then click End process. Next uninstall Chrome in Settings > Apps > Apps & Features. Restart PC. Then go into C:\Program Files and C:\Program Files (86) to find the Google folder and delete the Chrome Folder. You may need to Take Ownership first using this handy tool that will install to your right click mouse button: https://www.askvg.com/add-take-ownership-option... On the View tab of File Explorer then tick Hidden Files, open C:\Program Data to do the same. Go into Start > Windows Settings (gear icon) > Apps > Apps & Features > Google Chrome > Uninstall. Restart PC, reinstall Chrome from fresh download here: https://www.google.com/chrome/ I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved. ______________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites.
